node.text:
THE ONE THING YOU'LL NEVER GET BACK

You already know that time is the only thing we can not buy or buy back

Second by second, minute by minute, this value we place on said measured thing that is time is consistently fleeting, mysteriously exhausting within itself all that hath been said and that hath that been done

And all too often we humans are so busy planning our future or worrying about it. Or the inverse, we're reliving our past, at best, or more likely reliving our past mistakes and regrets

But what about the present moment

What about now

Many of us spend so much time stuck in the past and/or future that we never really live in the present moment at all

And this is just ludicrous for we're stuck living in something that doesn't exist, over and over and over again

You see the past doesn't exist and neither does the future. When you were actually experiencing those memories from the past, it was now. And when the future that you're planning for or worried about arrives, it wil be now

All we ever really have is now

This very moment that is upon us

This very moment that we're in

THIS PRESENT MOMENT

And mentally living anywhere outside of the present moment leads to all sorts of ailments that, like always, start in the psyche

It is well known and documented in the field of psychology that depression stems from living in the past and anxiety stems from worry of the future. And both of these are out of our control

Yet the one thing we can control, change and manipulate for the better is our present moment

So the next time you find yourself worrying or sullen may I offer these steps:

Stop whatever your doing

Take 3 long deep breaths

Ask yourself if you are ok right now, in this very moment, (not later, not before)

If not, ask yourself what you need to be ok right now

Remind yourself that you have health, water, shelter, love to give and someone who loves you

Now ask yourself again in this very moment, what more do you need to be ok

And if there's something you truly need, write it down and then write down all the solutions you can come up with to get what you need. Then write down the steps to get there

Inspired by "The Power Of Now"
